intro: Cyrtandra sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Cyrtandra sandwicensis is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
